result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Paul A. Puccillo

records.addlTxt:
Attorney Emily Gaertner appeared for the State. Attorney Seth Elijah Johnson in court for Paul A. Puccillo. Defendant Paul A. Puccillo appeared by video, in custody. Clerk. M.Burke. Trailing the bond motion in 22CF1030.
Status conference scheduled for November 16, 2022 at 10:30 am.

NO RECORD MADE. Attorney Emily Gaertner appeared for the State. Attorney Seth Elijah Johnson in court for Paul A. Puccillo. Defendant Paul A. Puccillo appeared by video, in custody. ASJA has not been entered yet so Judge Rossell can not do anything on this case yet.
Status conference scheduled for October 5, 2022 at 10:00 am.

records.descr: Application for specific judicial assign approved

records.addlTxt: Defendant Paul A. Puccillo appeared with Attorney Seth Elijah Johnson.  Defendant in custody. Attorney Daniel Alejandro Bernard Deida appeared for the Prosecution.  Clerk JT  Minutes:  DE waives preliminary hearing; probable cause found.  Bound over.    DE requests substitution of Br 1; Br 2 assigned ( co-def assigned to Br 2).   Information filed; reading waived.  Not guilty plea entered. Scheduling Order given to Attorney in court.  Bond continued.  Judicial Pretrial - in court scheduled for September 15, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Attorney Andrew Burgoyne appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared by zoom w/ Attorney Johnson.   Clerk HMcBride.  Report reviewed.  Parties stip to the findings in the report.  Court finds DE competent to proceed. PH 9/6 945am. Time limits waived by parties and court.  Bond continued.

Attorney Andrew Burgoyne appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared by Attorney Johnson by zoom.   Clerk HMcBride.   DE's apearance excused - appeared earlier today at scheduled hearing time. Atty Johnson has not reviewed report with DE yet. Adjmt granted.  CH 8/26 11am.  Bond continue.d
Competency hearing on August 26, 2022 at 11:00 am.

DE appears for 11:30 CH. Atty Johnson notified clerk that he has not reviewed report with DE yet.  CH set over to 3pm today due to ongoing hearing - DE's appearance excused for 3:00.  DE's contact info provided to court.  CH set over to 8/26 11am.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

  *Not to Possess or Consume Alcohol.  *Not To Possess or Consume Controlled Substances w/o a Prescription.  No drug paraphenalia  *Not To Discuss Case w/Eileen O'D.

03:55 PM    Assistant District Attorney Brenda Valdes appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Seth Johnson.   Clerk JT  Minutes: DE will waive extradition.Competency hearing scheduled for July 20, 2022 at 11:30 am.. $500  Cash Bond Set w/conditions (see bond entry). Attorney raises issue of competency. Comp exam ordered. rb
